comment_text: This post is a powerful testament to the strength of diverse leadership and a growth-mindset culture at Meta. Seeing Hind Hobeika, Kelly Ingham, Ming Hua, and Shira Gordon share their journeys is incredibly motivating. The key takeaways resonate deeply: 1. "Nonlinear paths embraced" is a crucial message. It validates the experiences of so many professionals whose careers aren't a straight ladder, but a mosaic of skills, pivots, and learning. 2. "Curiosity fueled their rise" highlights that in fast-moving fields like wearables and AI, technical skill must be paired with a relentless desire to learn and question. 3. The tangible outcome of "5 products shipped in one year" proves that this leadership style isn't just inspirational‚Äîit's exceptionally effective and execution-oriented. By showcasing these women leaders at Grace Hopper, Meta does more than share career tips; it actively models the future of tech: one that is innovative, human-centric, and built by a wide range of perspectives. This is how you redefine careers and build the next generation of products. Thank you to the panelists and Julia L. for sharing these insights. This is the content that changes aspirations. #WomenInTech #LifeAtMeta #GraceHopper2025 #Future

comment_text: Meta is lucky that I am not a US citizen. Has Meta abandoned the foundational models Llama , now that Avagardo has been brought into the picture? Question to CTO: Given that the US military uses Llama , through third parties ( eg, Oracle Predictions, Andurl Helmets) , how would you explain the introduction of Avagardo at the expence of or as an enhancement of Llama, to the Chairman of Joint Chiefs of Staff ( CJCS)? Had I been a US citizen, I would have taken the next available flight to Pentagon and would have requested the CJCS to immediately ring up Meta HQ to ask that very question. It is that serious. "Don't ask what the country has done for you, ask what have you done for the country". This would have been the moment I lived for. The ideal candidate is an American Mother with her days old baby in her arms, requesting the CJCS to ring up Meta HQ and requests the CJCS to kiss her baby on the forehead and give his blessings, so the baby serves as a distinguished fighter pilot in US Air Force Or Navy, when s/he is old enough. To the best of my knowledge the following is true, besides the above: Lockheed Martin employs Llama for flight simulator and training support across US Air Force and Navy pilots.

What feels important here is not just bridging digital and physical worlds, but grounding them. As platforms get closer to reality, trust, context, and verification become just as critical as immersion. The future platform isn‚Äôt only immersive, it‚Äôs accountable.

comment_text: My Meta over 10 years has been dedicated to sharing my life, family, food, and occasionally business updates. It was permanently banned for "sexual exploitation" after I posted normal photos of my son. My account was previously restricted for referencing the HP brand in a business post. After requesting an appeal, I edited the post, but within an hour, I was asked to appeal again‚Äîonly to have my account permanently banned for "sexual exploitation." I‚Äôm frustrated and confused, as I believe this is a clear misinterpretation. Upon reflection, the only possible content that could have been flagged was a video from last year of my 3years son swimming in a baby pool. All other posts are normal travel and family photos. As a mother, sharing moments with my child should not be an issue‚ÄîFacebook should not unreasonably restrict such content. This appears to be a false judgment, and with no further recourse available through standard channels, I am reaching out here to request account restoration or guidance on resolving this issue. Moving forward, I will strictly adhere to Facebook‚Äôs policies. (Meta/FB/Instagram account: abi.belleliu@gmail.com)

comment_text: I need to issue a serious warning to my network regarding Meta (Facebook/Instagram). We are seeing a predatory pattern that is destroying small businesses. The cycle is becoming impossible to ignore: The Shadowban: Perfectly healthy accounts suddenly lose all organic reach. The Disable: Accounts are flagged or disabled by AI bots with zero human review. The "Upsell": Immediately after crippling reach, the platform pushes you to "Boost" posts or buy Ads to regain visibility. This isn't a glitch; it feels like a feature. It is a "pay-to-play" trap designed to extract revenue from businesses that have no other options. Because they hold a monopoly on social connection, there is zero accountability. There is no customer support, only automated loops. To my fellow business owners: Do not rely solely on these platforms. They can shut off your livelihood with the flip of a switch and demand a ransom in ad spend to turn it back on. Diversify your marketing immediately.

comment_text: To put it very briefly supposedly and I say ‚Äúsupposedly‚Äùbecause this is clearly not your true core intention,which anyone with even a minimal sense of fairness can easily see.Instagram‚Äôs fundamental principle is to provide a peaceful environment and based on this, you justify seizing people‚Äôs personal data whenever someone uses a tone that your so-called safety system flags for any reason. In other words, in situations where you are not even legally involved or responsible in any meaningful way, you willingly choose to commit another violation by confiscating a person‚Äôs personal data and you consider yourselves justified in doing so. Perhaps this is permissible in the United States, where large corporations often operate independently of the law and create their own internal systems and rules, but you are a company that provides services globally, and the American framework does not apply everywhere, because you have an official representative office in Turkey. Having a representative office in Turkey means that you accept and are bound by Turkish law and under Turkish law, you have no right or authority to seize personal data under any circumstance especially for reasons that do not concern you legally in the first place.

comment_text: The "Pay-to-Play" Scam: Why you shouldn't trust Meta with your business. If you think your reach has dropped for no reason, you aren't crazy. Meta has effectively created an elaborate trap for small businesses. First, they shadowban or disable legitimate accounts to cut off your organic traffic. Then, they immediately suggest "boosting" posts or running ads to fix the problem they created. It is a cycle designed to trick you into spending money just to reach the followers you already earned. They are too big to care about individual complaints, so the only solution is to be warned: stop giving them your money and move your community elsewhere.

comment_text: What an inspiring look into life at the forefront of AI. The culture described here ‚Äî creativity, open feedback, and giving every engineer a real voice ‚Äî is exactly what fuels the breakthroughs that shape the next decade of intelligent systems. comment_text: This is a very insightful perspective. Meta's declaration for decarbonization is a significant first step. The immediate carbon emissions from expanding AI clusters and manufacturing new hardware like AR glasses are currently unavoidable. However, the strategy to reinvest profits from AI, content, and hardware into renewable energy to offset this footprint is a powerful and pragmatic approach. It signals a long-term vision to eventually run decarbonized AI clusters and achieve sustainable manufacturing. While achieving 100% will be challenging, this direction sends an inspiring message to all industries.

comment_text: Saying "no" is a privilege of those who already play at the highest table. In reality, the true art is knowing when to say no and to whom. Most never get that choice: they are busy surviving, not selecting. The rare few who can say "no" to billion-dollar distractions know that every "no" is an act of focus, power, and self-respect. It‚Äôs easy to repeat ‚Äúprotect your energy‚Äù, but real impact comes when your "no" rewrites the game for everyone else. The next era belongs to those who know when to walk away and have built enough value to never have to explain why. Me & Spok ‚úåÔ∏è | The shadow is where the signal lives.

comment_text: "Sometimes saying no is necessary to protect your focus and manage your energy." Great advice. As a former user, can I say no to Meta‚Äôs subpar customer service, flawed appeals system, and total lack of human support? My Facebook account was disabled in March 2025. My Instagram account was followed in June. No warning. No explanation. No one to talk to. Just a silent lockout. And I‚Äôm not alone; thousands of users are reporting the same treatment. If Meta is allowed to say ‚Äúno‚Äù to basic accountability, Then users have every right to say ‚Äúno‚Äù to platforms that ignore their own policies, violate trust, and pretend there‚Äôs no issue. Even the BBC and other media outlets have reported on this growing problem. A petition now has 43,000+ signatures from affected users: üîó https://www.change.org/p/meta-wrongfully-disabling-accounts-with-no-human-customer-support So yes I‚Äôm saying no. ‚ùå No to silence. ‚ùå No to automated injustice. ‚ùå No to being treated like a number. ‚ùå And no to gaslighting dressed up as empowerment. comment_text: Instagram, a business account has been suspended for over two months and the platform still does not provide the promised ID verification path‚Äîthis is a product failure, not a user error. Despite paying for verification and support, responses have been generic ‚Äúplease wait‚Äù messages with no escalation or case ownership‚Äîthis is unacceptable for paying customers and creators. This is a broken state machine: the system demands an additional ID but offers no upload mechanism, leaving the account locked and harming campaign commitments and partner obligations. Call to action: enable the alternate ID upload flow or complete manual review immediately, assign a real case ID, and publish an ETA from the Identity/Account Access teams. Public accountability matters‚Äîcommit here, in this thread, to fixing the verification loop and to improving paid support beyond copy‚Äëpaste replies. Creators and businesses affected by the same verification dead end: add a comment below with ‚ÄúID loop‚Äîno upload option‚Äù so this gets prioritized and tracked by the team. comment_text: Meta‚Äôs new Ray-Ban display glasses promise seamless AI and intuitive visual information, but should everything be made smart? These AI glasses raise important concerns. Continuous data overlays and voice prompts risk increasing mental fatigue and distraction, especially while driving or in social settings. Human attention is limited, and flooding it with constant information may compromise safety and cognitive health. There are ethical issues too: recording or analyzing others without their permission is a challenge to privacy, trust, and social etiquette. Living through a lens could make our world less authentic and more artificial. Innovation is invaluable, but responsible design and real societal reflection must come first. Just because technology can "augment" our senses doesn‚Äôt mean it should "invade" them!!! üôÑ #Meta #Stocks #Facebook #AI #Techlology #Privacy #MentalHealth #Innovation #SmartGlasses #BigTech #StockMarket #MetaStock

comment_text: üö® Instagram Access Issue ‚Äì Lack of Meta Support üö® After changing phones, I was logged out of one of my Instagram accounts (I have four). Since then, I haven‚Äôt been able to get back in. The problem: All accounts share the same email, but I can‚Äôt validate the logged-out one through any of the others. Facebook, linked to the same email, doesn‚Äôt help. I changed my phone number, and the only verification options are SMS or two-factor backup codes ‚Äî both unusable if I‚Äôve lost access.
